website_summaries.verdict: The Echo Buds are likable earbuds with always-on Alexa and solid Bose-powered noise reduction -- just consider waiting until they're on sale before buying them.
pros: The Amazon Echo Buds sound good, have hands-free Alexa and Bose noise-reduction technology
They're sweat resistant, fit comfortably and work well for making calls
cons: In noisier environments, you sometimes can't activate Alexa with your voice
You charge the Buds via Micro-USB instead of USB-C

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: First off I am a Faithful Amazon Customer I use them for everything from Amazon music to prime now etc. I have every Echo device made and this one is a major fail. Amazon should not have released this yet. They are Bulky, heavy, and fit terrible. The touch works 35% of the time. I am very disappointed with this product and will be returning them. From now on I will not pre order devices until others share Reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work 50% of the Time
customer_reviews.text: Got real tired of trying to constantly pair with iPhone XSMax. Constantly going through phone settings, shutting down/re-opening alexa, taking buds in and out, opening and closing the box, etc etc etc. Spent half the time trying to pair the stupid device, which will work for a few moments and stop. Right ear bud will not charge with wingtips, contrary to advertising. Buds are also huge and cumbersome. Complete product fail.
customer_reviews.author: Delvin Douchebaggery

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to Like Them
customer_reviews.text: This looked like a great product but sadly being returned. Beware the large tips are about the size of normal medium tips. They have XL BUT you have to pay $15 for an entire kit to get them. If you use the optional large wing then the buds won’t fit right in the charger. Noise reduction was minimal, there’s a reason it’s not called noise cancellation. Bottom line if you have smaller ears and get get a nice sealed fit these are probably good for you. If not you won’t have great sound and they won’t be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: Touch Controls and Fitting are a nightmare.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these off Best Buy and currently trying to fight through all the nuisances that I'm having. All supplied tips dont fit well and buds never fit correctly. I ended up using the tips from another pair of 10 dollar headphones that fit better than anything provided in the package. I am also unable to get the damn touch working on the ear buds for controls. The double tap works but the other option is near to impossible to get working correctly. I have been trying to see if I can get used to these but these are going back if they dont show up anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Klow

customer_reviews.title: Evasive return policy
customer_reviews.text: Extremely evasive return policy company too afraid to look bad so I had to return upon advice of rep after not being able to get a return even after trying several times Edit: second time I chose to get a replacement as the option was available but when you click it it re directs you to customer service........ so yea still being evasive. I cant tell if the speakers are blown out or if theyre still having this “software problem” I keep hearing about. If you want to avoid a disaster with a new product DONT BE LIKE AMAZON....
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Almost great value but ... unreliable and buggy. Buds 2.0 Might be great.
customer_reviews.text: I loved these earbuds -- briefly. When they worked. Can't reliably stay connected to Bluetooth. Or connects to BT but app doesn't see the earbuds. Or you take buds off and put them in the case, but they remain connected to the phone. Case is cheap, doesn't close securely, buds can come unseated and discharge. Could be a great value when Amazon fixes its software and replaces the case. Sound plus noise cancelling is unmatched at this price. But, sadly, this product was not ready to ship to customers :(
customer_reviews.author: JimF

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!!
customer_reviews.text: I see a lot of negative reviews but, I personally love them!!! I had a cheap pair of ear buds that would cut out for a second all the time. It was super annoying. These do not have that problem. Plus I found these buds fit way more comfortably!! I used them all day last weekend when raking and blowing leaves. The noise reduction when I had the blower on was amazing!! Also my wife hates them cause I do not hear her talk to me when I have them on. Haha. Like anything there are some small changes I’d make but overall I love this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Pursel

customer_reviews.title: MISSING MULTIPLE PARTS.
customer_reviews.text: So far so bad. Received them 4 hours ago. Just began setup & I find there are zero large tips (blue) only 2 small & 2 medium (green & red) contrary to the manual. Also, there are 2 right medium wingtips but zero LEFT medium wingtips. There are a Left & Right pair of small and of large wingtips. So, I’ve never got to use them & there are multiple parts missing. NOT off to a good start, Amazon! Now, if I can get the parts without having to return everything & wait for them to send me an entirely new replacement item (which, with MULTIPLE missing parts, I’m not very optimistic the replacement will be complete, either.)
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Returning due to multiple issues
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these ear buds but just one week later I am returning them. I have a persistent issue with distorted sound in the right side, the touch controls only work with the double tap not the press and hold and I have taken two phone calls and both times the caller could barely hear me but could easily hear all the surrounding noises like others talking and cars passing. I am pairing with an iPhone 11pro with the most up to date version of Alexa
customer_reviews.author: FrogKisser

customer_reviews.title: Down the toilet!
customer_reviews.text: These did not block background noise. Additionally the fit was awkward, so much so that one of mine fell into the toilet and immediately malfunctioned. I had such great hopes, but I had to return these.
customer_reviews.author: Crazymom

customer_reviews.title: Pro: Alexa, Noise-cancelling, Pass through . Con: disconnects, charging case.  RETURNED
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Bose noise cancelling works, pass through is also great, Alexa integration is fantastic. Cons: they disconnect constantly and at short range. As in, it would disconnect from my iPhone when I put the phone in my back pocket. The case is also a problem, as when you have the rubber fit pieces on them, it frequently interferes with the buds charging in the case. These two problems were bad enough for me to return them in frustration, despite everything else being wonderful about them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Block

customer_reviews.title: No text messaging using Alexa
customer_reviews.text: When trying to use Alexa to send a text message, she said that it wasn’t supported on this device (this after they advertised it). (Strike One) As I’m talking with Amazon customer support using the echo buds, they said that they were having trouble hearing me. (Strike Two). Listening to music has no bass even with it turned all the way up. It was like listening to a couple earphones. (Strikes Three - You’re out!)
customer_reviews.author: Diantane

customer_reviews.title: The HISS is killing me
customer_reviews.text: I've chatted with tech support and I'm supposed to leave my buds connected to my phone, in the case and open, and it'll update the firmware to get rid of this terrible hiss, but it's been hours and nothing... no update. SMH. ETA 01/27/19 I returned them. Even after the firmware update they continued to hiss. I have cheaper wireless earbuds that do not hiss, so it was very disappointed with these.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Like others said, wanted to like these but I hate them
customer_reviews.text: These did not fit right in my ears. I tried and also bought the memory foam versions hoping that would help but no. I have some bluetooth headphones I bought at Costco for less than 1/2 the price that sound 100 times better than these. I have my entire house automated with Echos and really wanted to use these but unfortunately these just don't work right. Amazon I want to buy this product but returning these until you fix these. Who did the testing on these?
customer_reviews.author: Tim L

customer_reviews.title: Generally it's working as expected except a few.
customer_reviews.text: I tried those: 1. Noise reduction, works well, but not 100% off, I can still hear snoring -- I need to play music to "mute" the noise. 2. Pass through mode, when there is no music, the background noise is loud -- Why? 3. Alexa control, works well, I used it to set reminder, audible, so far so good. 4. Comfortable, I have to use the smallest one, still not comfortable for long hours. 5. Battery, right ear uses about 1.5 faster than the left. It's almost as advertised, up to 5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs more work
customer_reviews.text: After using the Echo Buds for a bit, because I wanted to give them a fair shot before returning them, here are my issues: 1. No option to control volume on the earbud - (Samsung Galaxy Earbuds can do this) 2. No option to change wake word, so it confuses my home Echo. 3. Occasional speaker crackling noise. I am disappointed. I am generally satisfied with Amazon brand products, but this one misses the mark. Hopefully future models will improve. I changed my review from 2 stars to 3 stars because I do like that they pause when you take them out of your ears and i like the button on the case to pair.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L

customer_reviews.title: I actually stopped when seeing how bad the wings were!
customer_reviews.text: The Wings are a rubber band like contraption that you have to wriggle over the body, then after install, the buds no longer are able to connect to case magnets for charging! The wings push the buds away from charge connectors! Support say, just remove every time you want to charge! OMG! Then take 3-4 minutes per pair to wriggle back over body. I must have wings as I walk around, get in and out of vehicle, bend over. Plus the bubs without wings were not snug for me and felt loose. As badly as I wanted them to work for me they had to go back.
customer_reviews.author: 4591Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: When I have gone through the specifications I thought it would be great purchase. However, after I bought it and using for couple of days... I got to know that this is not what I expected.. 1. I am not sure but for some reason that the double tap controls are not quick responsive 2. couple of times that the Bose/Passthrough controls did not work at all 3. It really does not work for Works outs such Cardio/treadmill Walk/running 4. When I used those ear secure tips , its really paining 5. I am not sure about the other ear phones similar to these but these feel bit heavier on your ears
customer_reviews.author: Pk

customer_reviews.title: Cannot, CANNOT be powered off! WOW
customer_reviews.text: Utter insanity, you CANNOT power these off, AT ALL. I read a few tech reviews and this was never mentioned. So imagine the surprise of having them fully charged, didn't use them that day... Go to use the next day... Battery is drained. THESE STAY ON 24/7, CANNOT BE POWERED OFF. W.. T..
customer_reviews.author: Jay Tee

customer_reviews.title: Awful again Amazon keeps asking me to leave another feedback
customer_reviews.text: Totally disappointed in another half baked alexa product. Very difficult tapping your ear while driving. Over and over had it miss almost every command. No audible driving directions. Google integration doesn't work. Just like their fake product echo frames. It's in stock, but no shipments and no YT reviews. Awful and fake; Alexa and echo are reaching new lows.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Watt

customer_reviews.title: These would be GREAT if Alexa would respond consistently
customer_reviews.text: Got them yesterday. They worked AWESOME for hours. I'd say 4 out of 5 times, Alexa replied. Once in a while, I'd have to repeat her name several times. I Charged them. And today. Alexa will not respond. She won't answer. I've gone through settings. I even reset. And she responded ONCE. And now... nothing. They are basically over priced ear buds with NO integration. If they worked like they did before I charged them, they'd be awesome. I don't know if I got a defective set of them or not, but these are going BACK. I'm really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Marrero

customer_reviews.title: Kinda Poopoo
customer_reviews.text: They’re ok but definitely not worth the money. I lost one last night going to bed and tried to use the play sound option in the Alexa app only to find out that it doesn’t work at all. So now I have 1 earbud that can’t pair to my phone because you need both to connect. It’s not as high tech as I was lead to believe by the price and description. It also can’t do customized tap controls. I don’t know if I just got unlucky and got a pair that doesn’t work properly or if it’s just a crappy item but I’m pretty disappointed in it
customer_reviews.author: Yee man

customer_reviews.title: bulky and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty bulky and uncomfortable. The silicon cover is hard to put on. The case is huge and awkward to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Yong

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for market release
customer_reviews.text: This product needs a lot of work. Connection is sporadic, and touch sensitivity is very unreliable. Putting the wing-tips causes them to not charge or connect properly. I will be returning this product. Also, there needs to be an 'off-function" otherwise battery drains, or it has to be in the charging case at all time. I thought these would be rivals of Airpods but they don't even rival my $20 Bluetooth-wired earbuds ://
customer_reviews.author: S K.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but painful to wear
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these! The sound is great, the pass-through is interesting and the responsiveness is good but the body of the buds is so large they hurt after 20-30 minutes of use! My ears are average and the silicone tips play no part in the discomfort but wearing these for more than 20 minutes causes the cartilage of my ears to throb and I have to go back to my AirPods. I wish the sound quality and other benefits outweighed the physical pain in wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: RiverRari

customer_reviews.title: Not Ready for Prime Time
customer_reviews.text: “Siri” simply did not work unless I was using the earbuds in a quiet environment. I am looking for wireless earbuds to use while cycling, and the failure of “Siri” is a non-starter. The fit was a little painful regardless of eartip size. The pass through setting allowed too much wind noise to make them useful. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: G Jo

customer_reviews.title: No "Find my Headphones" feature like the Bose equivalent products.
customer_reviews.text: Bose headphones (Soundsport for example) have a "Find My Buds" feature. I cannot find any feature like this for the echo buds. The sounds and everything works great on them. But what use is it if I loose them tomorrow and never find them again? I will happily change my review is this feature is added. But until this feature is added I won't use these ear buds because I will loose them somewhere in my own home, with no way to find them. Please add this future. It is the only reason this product is not a 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: TanmanJF

customer_reviews.title: Too many bugs.  I'm sending back.
customer_reviews.text: Too many bugs for this first model. Good ideas but poor execution. Despite following instructions carefully, will only pair to "Hey Google" on my Samsung brand new Galaxy S10 smart phone. Won't pair to Alexa app. Also won't synchronize or correctly read google calendar or Alexa calendar. BT connection is iffy. Music playback is spotty and often doesn't work. Not as good fidelity as I expected on music. Bose noise cancellation not as good as expected. Tapping ear bud for different functions is spotty. Music equalizer doesn't seem to work. Can't increase base response.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No longer a dissappointment
customer_reviews.text: After a firmware update, I went to 5 stars. Great noise cancellation. I love these, and wear them in the truck, and at work.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These Bluetooth earbuds connect automatically even if the case is closed. The real problem is the alarm won’t de heard if the Bluetooth is turned on. Every other Bluetooth earbud I’ve had, had to be out of the case or have the case opened to be connected and still I don’t recall any issues with the alarm.. I missed a meeting and flight.. Apple was the one to identify the cause of the alarm not working after two hours of trouble shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Morton

customer_reviews.title: Worst amazon product, not as good as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Cons: 1. "ok" flat sound 2. sound reduction works, but it reduces about 10-15% percent of backgroud noise, some times I can't even notice a difference in of/off noise reduction. 3. Touch gestures does not work properly, you will need some train. And could not make it work with Google Assistant on my pixel 3. 4. constant static white noise even when passtrough and noice reduction turned off, and it really noticable. 5. bad fitting Pros: 1. Passtrough mode works realy well 2. Good microphone quality Summary: I does not recommend it to buy at that price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The sound is normally fine, whether or not it wants to play through them all the time is however not fine. For whatever reason that is unknown to me if you happen to be holding one it might make a loud beep before turning the audio on the normal speaker. Voice recognition does nothing. Trying to launch spotify with it, or using any voice commands ends up doing nothing at all. Noise canceling works, but passthrough picks up the most grating noises and amplifies them which is terrible design. They are comfortable at the very least. Just severely disappointing in every other way
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Not a good match for Apple phone 10 max
customer_reviews.text: If you have an Apple phone don’t buy these. They don’t stay connected. You can’t answer calls with them. If you take them out of your ears and put them back in their case, you have to restart your phone to hear anything through the phone. Also you can’t switch from talking using the phone then connecting to the earbuds while on a call.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Yell

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, died in <1 year
customer_reviews.text: Sound and usability was fine, but earbuds stopped working less than one year after purchase. Would not recommend spending >$100 for pair of basically “disposable” headphones. Under 1 year. Who do I contact as this should be covered under one year! Cannot find any way to get response on warranty issue
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not perfect either.
customer_reviews.text: They're okay. I think there's a lot of exaggeration in both directions. They're definitely not bad but they're not excellent either. Only one bud is connecting at a time right now and I don't know why. I LOVE the active noise reduction. I haven't had an issue with the double- tap but the press and hold seems glitchy. Some bugs that I am confident will be ironed out and then they'll be awesome. Sound quality and comfort are mostly subjective but the sound is clear and deep. They fit snugly for me with wingtips but of course that varies by the user.
customer_reviews.author: Double T

customer_reviews.title: Fix your charging case and then I will buy them again!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit and the alexa integration and I tried really hard to keep these but had to return them. I had to return them because they need to fix how they charge. The charging case is too sensitive and I struggled to keep the right one charged and almost every time I wanted to use them one was dead. Also getting them to pair can be very difficult as well. I will keep an eye on them when they update the case I will be interested in buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Frequent issues while using, possible defective item received
customer_reviews.text: I’m a little bit disappointed with these earbuds, as I was looking for some great earbuds for in the office. The tap/hold feature is unresponsive, Alexa could not be summoned (even though the feature was turned on), and the Passthrough feature doesn’t pick up on the voices of my coworkers, only the machines. Occasionally one bud will drop sound altogether. I’m frequently testing the audio for it to fail repeatedly. I’m truly hoping that my set is just defective and will be replacing them to see if that’s the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Garbitt

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money or time on these.
customer_reviews.text: Three days after the return window closed these earbuds took a dump. They won’t pair. They won’t factory reset. All I get is a red flashing light. I tried getting help through Amazon’s useless customer service. I tried chat at first and kept getting disconnected. Once I got a real person, oh I’m sorry the return window is closed. Basically kiss our ass and thanks for your money. Also we don’t stand by our products. I wouldn’t recommend these to anyone. You are really taking a chance on the product and on Amazon crappy customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Just garbage. Utter trash. And on top of it, the noise cancellation is a complete lie
customer_reviews.text: The more I reflect on these, the more irritated I am at this garbage product. It doesn't work under iOS. Never started Siri. The noise cancellation is garbage. For example, in PLAYS outside noise into your ear (called "pass-through"). Then, in "noise cancellation mode" it just stops added the additional outside noise. That's not cancellation. That's just not playing outside noise. On top of that, the actual quality is garbage. Had problems charging and problems with connecting to Bluetooth. AND YOU NEED AMAZON'S TRACKING APP TO ACTIVATE THESE! Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Testing Test

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy the Echo buds!! Watch My Video on Why!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to check out my full video review on the Amazon Echo Buds and why I simply can not recommend them!! I also did a water test video, but Amazon only allows one video.
customer_reviews.author: David O.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality on 2 pairs. Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I like the style of these earbuds. I do not like the quality of these though. I'm on my second pair after my first pair had distorted sound quality. I returned the first one. Second pair was perfect for a while, but the poor volume and distorted sound quality has returned. This happens on all devices even with adjustment to the equalizer. The price of these buds are not worth it at all. I bought a cheap pair as a back up and they sound better than these echo buds. I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Conley

customer_reviews.title: Great sound...when working.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these almost 8 months ago. I have had to return them 3 times!!! The first two times the left bud went completely out. This last time the right bud went out. I loved them when they would work, but not going to keep replacing them. So now I’m getting a refund, but I am losing $35.00 or more due to the length of time it has been since I purchased them. Never heard such madness. Amazon should coordinate with Bose to see why their earbuds continuously stop working.
customer_reviews.author: G. Will

customer_reviews.title: They broke within the first month, left doesn't charge doesn't pair via bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Worked great originally, then stopped working. Left bud won't hold charge, won't pair via bluetooth. I was going to return it, but my printer broke to print forms. I like Amazon Alexa products but the echo buds have quality issues (or at least the ones I got did). Now stuck with them because I can't print return forms. Luckily got on sale and didn't pay full price but I am still out about $90+. I would avoid until another version is perfected.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Edison

customer_reviews.title: wing tips flaw
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like them but there seems to be a flaw with the wing tips. When they are on, they fit great in my ear but not so much in the case. When I replace the ear buds back in the case, I either have trouble closing the case they do not sit in the magnetic holder to charge. It's a bit frustrating. Update 06/15/2020 - Wingtips are less of an issue fitting in the case but the fit is a bit sloppy. I feels like the earbuds get greasy and the wingtips slide around making me have to adjust the earbuds constantly. I clean them every time I put them on but still get a sloppy fit.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo A. R. Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Medium quality, high price
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality is comparable to a $70 pair of jawbone. Google Assistant works better than Alexa on these, even with Amazon apps. Alexa does not open or control Google apps. In some cases, Alexa could not open or control Amazon apps. Volume is somewhat low. With pass through on, noisy places will overpower highest volume. Noise cancellation works great, even with ear tips that came with it. These are ok, but I feel I paid too much. 11/15: After 2 weeks, sound level seems to have dropped even more. I was not satisfied with these and returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Haley

customer_reviews.title: Good earbuds with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for a few months now and have the following comments. The sound is good but finding the correct fit has been problematic. It may be my particular circumstance, although there is nothing uncommon about my ear holes. Using them now occasionally for a few months I find that the left ear bud has developed a squeal when the volume changes or fingers are inserting, or adjusting the ear bud. The other peculiarity is the light on the case...you need a crystal ball to tell you what the light is telling you. I also find that the ear bud may not seat properly in the case and does not charge when it need to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get them to stay in with all sizes and wingtips
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these and tried over and over again. I have no problem with Apple's airpods but was excited for these given the significantly cheaper price the same features as the Airpod Pros. Unfortunately, just could not get them to stay in, particularly during exercise (but even around the house). Sending mine in for a return and going with something else. My other main issue was the tapping features. For some reason, even though the double tap usually worked, the press and hold feature only worked about 40% of the time. I oftentimes had to try it multiple times before getting Alexa or Siri to activate.
customer_reviews.author: JLOW

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding? volume reduction ??
customer_reviews.text: I love most of Amazon device except Kindle HR, ad this echo buds. Sound quality is even worse than $30 Chinese brand TWS. The noise reduction and pass through feature is ok, but I don't want volume reduction !!! Even maximize volume my phone, the sound from earbud is very low. Wit same set up, I tried Phiaton BT700 and perfectly sounds goods at through entire frequency range. I bought three sets echo buds, and now so disappointed !! Update 1 day after : I though my first set might defective, and tried 2nd set out of three. it's same bad sound quality. Amazon did good job on sounds with echo dot, but not buds.
customer_reviews.author: Good Dad

customer_reviews.title: Returning these- and will not be asking for a replacement
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to purchase these. Unfortunately, they are sub-par, and I go back to my corded Bose headphones regularly. The Alexa integration is wonderful, but the rest of this leaves something to be desired. The sound quality is incredibly poor, and they've officially stopped working less than two months later (and that is with very infrequent usage). They consistently fall out of my ear, and have to be shoved in to make them stay... (yes, I've tried all the fitting pieces they provide), which makes for a very uncomfortable listening experience. Will be returning to Bose or looking at Sony's moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: They stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: It saddens me to write a negative review on this product because I loved them when they were working for me. I bought two pair (one for me and one for my wife). I recommended these buds to several people because of the features and performance at a low price. After 4 months they stopped working for me. They power on, charge, and connect via Bluetooth but will not play any audio. I’ve reset/re-paired them several times only to find the same results. The sad thing is that the same thing happened to my wife’s pair.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Bad case. Bad fit.
customer_reviews.text: Want to see what your ear looks like two-minutes after installing Alexa Ear Buds? See my picture. They fall out. The case concept is wonderful in principle but suffers from miserable execution because the ear buds won’t properly seat for charging or lid closure with the wings installed. Returning this product with a clever concept but substandard mechanical engineering.
customer_reviews.author: cantslowdown

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality and no way to change Wake Word means fail
customer_reviews.text: Sure, it understands your voice without pressing any buttons and that is cool. However, the software will not allow you to change the wake word... and saying "Computer" is my favorite thing about Alexa! So... the nail in the coffin is tinny sound with almost no bass, even after I adjusted the bass to max and mid and trebble down; you can not hear any bass... the frequency response must start at 400hz or something, it's TERRIBLE sound.
customer_reviews.author: Harlan

customer_reviews.title: wish they would have worked longer than 6 months...lol
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the echo buds for a few months, the noise cancelation is great. Sound quality could be better, but its not bad. Now out of no where they start making a high pitched squeal evertime I put them in. Also just recently the touch control buttons stopped working the right way. I really want to like these, spent enough on them. Wish they would have worked for more than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: katie bennett

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised by these earbuds. Sound quality is solid with balanced mids and highs and punchy bass. I tweaked the equalizer just a bit to get my desired sound. Build quality is average. Expected a little bit better for the price tag. Charging case is well built and does its job. The different color led’s on the charging case to tell the battery level of the case is just odd and not very intuitive. Overall these are a great buy and cheaper than AirPods. If you are expecting Sony or Bose ear buds type of sound than you will be disappointed. They are twice the price of these for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: RWM

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after reading a review that said these sound as good as Apple’s new earbuds. Pros: -I like how Alexa works -Good fit and they are comfortable -Price Cons: -Sound is just OK. My Bose and Jaybirds sound far better. -My biggest complaint is the rubber cover that helps them stay in your ear. They work great and are very comfortable BUT you can not close the charging case all the way and therefore they will not charge. Makes the rubber cover worthless. Good try but would not recommend at this time. I hope they fix these short comings in the next version.
customer_reviews.author: CBK

customer_reviews.title: They won't fit anyone. No matter what tip size.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a full year now. They have cut the price in half now for a good reason. These don't fit your ears. It doesn't matter what size ear you have. These aren't comfortable by any means. If I were to get a refund I would invest in the Samsung buds. These buds did sound amazing and the nice cancellation is quite nice but if they are just going to fall out of your ears no matter what tip size you choose then it doesn't matter how good sound quality is. Just find something that'll actually fit. I realized how important that is now.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the Echo Buds! I expected they would be a fair quality- I was WRONG , first they don’t stay in my ears( I tried all the ear adapters and purchased soft upgrade inserts the wings hurt, doesn’t stay connected to my Alexa app and now the left ear doesn’t work. Very disappointed Marco Melone
customer_reviews.author: Marco Melone

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife happy life
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife and she loves them. The sound is amazing. Having Alexa in them is great but if your in the same room with an Alexa product it sometimes gets confused. Not sure how they work in outside loud environments but I'm sure they'll do ok as long as it's not super loud. It's tough to beat mother nature. I waited for these buds to go on sale and they did for 90 bucks. My daughter has the original apple earpods and these sound better and has better functionality at a cheaper price. I'm not telling you what to buy just trying to give a much info to help you buy the best pair for you.
customer_reviews.author: yerblues86

customer_reviews.title: Great product for phones only.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty great product if you only want to use it with your phone. It’s a nightmare to try and pie with other devices like laptops and desktops tho. Pairing issues and competition with the car is a a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Maskelony

customer_reviews.title: They’re great...and I waited the full 30 days.
customer_reviews.text: I really like them. I liked them out of the box, but was a little too concerned about what other people thought and kept reading reviews. I was insecure about my small ears fitting nicely with the large tips that originally came on the buds. The noise canceling was amazing out of the box, but I tried wearing the smaller tips, which made the fit terrible and the sound off. I guess I’m vain. The sleeves ruined the fit as well...which is why I’m taking a star off. As is out of the box was perfect. My husband tried them and loved them too. I’m not a tech junkie, but the sound, noise canceling, and Alexa work great for us!
customer_reviews.author: GMT

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: *Second Update* After chasing my tail in the Amazon construct, I've filed a complaint with my bank. Do not buy. *Update* Amazon has been refusing to do anything. I've opened two cases, sent multiple messages, and have had no response. Do not buy these ear buds, at this point they don't even make for a decent paper weight. $130 down the drain. They worked great for about two months. I'm now stuck in tech support hell. The right ear developed a nasty buzzing sound that makes it unusable. I opened a case several days ago and Amazon has been of zero service.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling ear buds with Alexa integration, not audiophile, and not audiophile cost..
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what everyone is complaining about, these things are great! I've only experienced 2 minor drawbacks since purchasing; 1 bluetooth drop and one conference call via phone app that failed. Otherwise, it's been great. They are responsive to touch, but not overly responsive where inadvertent touches cause false hits. Charging and discharging have been fairly close. Sound quality is average for this price range. As a longtime Bose customer and existing Bose headphone user, these are NOT Bose audio quality, but the noise reduction is. Let's be honest.. these are earbuds, not over the ear studio monitor's. Let's be sensible people.. it's a gadget and it's cool.
customer_reviews.author: Drew W.

customer_reviews.title: Not recomended. Item Looks goid but don't work.
customer_reviews.text: I got this item about 3 months ago when were introducing to the market. About a month ago the left side stop connecting. I called amazon to let them know and IT departmen were trying to fix the problem but they decided to replace it because it is broke. They said that they were going to call me. Is one month and I have not receive neither the call or the earbuds replacement. I got them in payments. Amazon collect my payment but this item is not working. I do not recomend at all. Do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Grizz

customer_reviews.title: Good when it worked
customer_reviews.text: When I first got them had some issues getting them to fit well but after playing around with the different size ear pods (buds not sure the exact correct word) they fit pretty well the sound quality was good and noise cancellation was ok (not as good as I expected but works). But I can not recommend them because basically a few days after getting them they just stopped working. Maybe because it is new and there is some initial quality control issues but if it works its good but when it stopped working just a few days after getting it seems like something is wrong.
customer_reviews.author: James Moratti

customer_reviews.title: Makes Alexa even more fun.
customer_reviews.text: I use this product at work a lot. I can touch them when i need to hear someone then tap them again to only hear the music/video i am listening too. Sound quality is good. When you actually get the right size going on they will not fall out or even start to come out of your ear. Voice recognition is great and ease of use is also awesome. My only complaint is that the buds can hurt my ears after a few minutes. I have went through the sizes and not gotten them super comfy yet. But i like using Alexa everywhere i go..its super convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Dupree

customer_reviews.title: Best in class earbuds for me!
customer_reviews.text: I am not an audiophile and as I am older (69) I’m sure my hearing has degraded. Having said that I find these Echo Buds excellent. They sound as good anything I’ve listened to up to about $300. There are actual over the ear headphones that do better, however, in their price range I haven’t found anything better. They are good on phone calls, the noice cancelling is great and the Alexa integration is very good. For me, the fit is good bud ear shape really makes a difference so, your experience may vary. I think they are a great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Allmost a great set of earbuds
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great and the Alexa thing is cool but I cant use it much at work. The band around the earbud that helps keep the unit from falling out needs to be redesigned to stay on better and they need a larger set of Ear pieces for your ears. My other complaint is, everytime I take them out of the case to use I have to put them back in and take them back out or they will never connect. I have tried resetting them etc, to remedy this issue but it doesn't go away. Time try the next set. Wish i could still return them.
customer_reviews.author: Big Cat Catcher

customer_reviews.title: They don’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this purchase. The sound is great, noise cancellation is great. Can’t say if the voice recognition is good or not because I never used it. My issue is within a few months the left earbud stopped working correctly. Sounds muffled sometimes, and when the volume of the music is lowered a certain extent the left earbud makes a loud steady high pitched squeal. Loud enough to hurt my ears. After checking online I found out this is actually a pretty common issue with these earbuds. I am in the process of returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony_Bac

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones but frustrating Alexa responses
customer_reviews.text: i think these sounds pretty good. Good noise cancelling too. But I got them over other to have alexa around and it honestly requires yelling most of the time to get them to work. And most of the time to get alexa to work I have to turn noice cancelling off. Just as easy to press a but for siri. I'm hoping they make some software updates that make this better but for now these are pretty much staying in the case unless I need them as headphones. My recommendation....buy something else for now. They are frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ack

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted these to work
customer_reviews.text: I really was hoping these would work. The noise cancelling works well but the overall problem is intermittent loss of sound in one earbud and sometimes there is crackling. It can be very frustrating when you are in the middle of a call with someone. I feel like Amazon could have done a much better job with these. They should also have come with additional accessories for a better fit to your ear. While they may seem to fit snugly they can still come out. Perhaps including over ear accessories should have been part of the package. Regardless, because of the sound issues I will have to be sending mine back.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Good noise cancelling for price, but controls setup does not work
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these buds have decent sound and noise cancellation, fit well, and connect quickly. However, you cannot configure the gestures to one tap. Also, even though I setup double tap as play/pause (it is checked in the settings), it keeps working for the ambient sound on/off function, which is the default setting. I tried connecting/reconnecting, turning on/off, different players, etc.; no results. A pity, as everything else works fine, but very limited controls is a big con for me. I am returning these tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: O. Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After 7 Months of Use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these in January and now need to see if Amazon will refund my purchase because they are no longer working. Also, ridiculous you need to download an additional app to use Alexa. This might be good for android phone users but kind of pointless if you have an iPhone. Just get yourself some AirPods and use Siri.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bixler

customer_reviews.title: Just disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I love amazon products. I was really expecting something great here and the price is reasonable if these worked well. Unfortunately I’ve had several issues and will be returning these. 1. The volume is pretty low and the sound just isn’t very good quality 2. The right ear bud pulse buzzes when not paired and sometimes when it is paired. 3. They get physically warm, the heat buildup after just 10-15mins is very noticeable. Pros 1. The noise canceling is really good 2. The fit is very secure. I don’t see these falling out even with dynamic movement. All in all, they need to polish out these issues, probably should have before release.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fit. I have the Apple AirPods and have a problem keeping them in my ears. Normal everyday routine they still work loose and fall out. The Echo Buds with the medium tips and small wings fit perfect and feels secure. The Sound is good and the noise reduction is great. I'm not a fan of pass through. It's like the hunting ear buds that amplify the sound. But with the fit and noise reduction the pass through works well for its intended use. I like them better than Apple AirPods and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth it
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had these before it was even out out since i pre-ordered. The sound quality is great the noise cancelling is great. Then it’s everything else: 1: its bulky and hurts and sometimes doesn’t want to stay in ear even with the extra wings 2: it doesn’t respond to touch well 3: if im at home and want to listen to music on my echo speakers, Alexa would end up playing in my ear even if im on a phone call and wouldn’t play on the echo speakers. I’m not a fan of these and will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: TriniGyal

customer_reviews.title: Great sound & noise cancellation...but
customer_reviews.text: I want to love these - the sound is better than my AirPods - these are like having surround sound, noise cancellation is phenomenal, Alexa is a definite plus, access to Siri is very convenient, smallest ear tips fit great, but the ear buds themselves are too big for my ears and are super uncomfortable. Going to give them a couple more days to see if I can get used to them, but I have to force them into my ear, and once in, they hurt. The wings provided don’t help the issue and I can’t use them, they just makes situation worse. Disappointing because I love everything about these except the fit.
customer_reviews.author: aliok63

customer_reviews.title: You have a long way to go
customer_reviews.text: The product stopped syncing with my phone after using a handful of times. I was disappointed that it didn't send texts to my contacts that did not have alexa capabilities. That is the biggest reason I needed smart headphones. Often times Alexa did not respond to my voice - I had to use my phone's microphone - so... what's the point?? Garbage. Sending back because it would no longer sync with my phone and the issue could not be resolved with tech support. Sorry Amazon - I want to like your product but you have a long way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jhopkinsrealty

customer_reviews.title: Tried for 2 weeks-sending back
customer_reviews.text: I am returning today. No one can hear me! I bought them as I am an Executive Assistant for a high-level CEO. I bought these as I need to have my hands free but I am also on the phone all the time on very important phone calls. I an so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Honest opinion, GREAT buds!
customer_reviews.text: Like it says in the title, this is a completely honest opinion - these are great ear buds! For the price these are awesome! You get everything in the AirPod pros for a much much cheaper price. If you want to see what these look like up close and a in detail opinion on these, search on YouTube: Echo Earbuds Julian Lonzoe. If you want to feel secure and comfortable while working out or doing activities, these are the durable ear buds for you.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Challenges using with Windows Laptop
customer_reviews.text: They work great with my phone (Samsung S9+) but I have a lot of challenges using them with Windows on Zoom, Google Meet and Microsoft teams. Frequently, the microphone doesnt get recognized, the bluetooth connection drops and I have to do a reset either by putting the buds in the case or restarting the laptop. I was using the over the ear Bose headsets earlier and had no issues. The pairing function is fairly easy but there is no mute option on the headsets. Overall, not happy with the performance. They are comfortable to use though when they work.
customer_reviews.author: Salil Sakhardande

customer_reviews.title: The tips are joke.
customer_reviews.text: The largest tip is like a small one from other brands. It's actually ridiculous how small the set is. And extra sleeves don't help the sound seal. Only when I put the largest of all tips I had, the seal was created. Only when there is perfect seal, the ANR works. (Tested with airplane sounds from YouTube.) Without the perfect seal, there is no effect. The only problem is that my biggest tips don't fit the charger. So pretty useless set for me. Update. Apparently Amazon has XL version sold separately. I have no idea why they don't include them.
customer_reviews.author: Radek

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time or money. These earbuds are huge, heavy and have terrible sound quality. I listen to audiobooks at night. Not with these earbuds! My ears hurt after ten minutes. I wanted something other than my Apple earbuds because those are too big and hurt my ears. Ha! These are so much worse. The sound quality is awful, when they connect. If they do connect, it’s only for a few minutes at a time. Now, I’ll probably be stuck with them because of this lockdown... but if I can’t return them, I won’t be wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: M L

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones but don’t last at all!!!
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds themselves are awesome but I have had them less than a year and the left earbud quit charging so I can never use it. They also cut in and out constantly. I have to keep putting them in the case and pulling them out again so they will connect again. Extremely frustrating considering the price. And now I can’t get ahold of amazon to report the issue. I obviously can’t afford to buy a new set while one of them still works. Just upset.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bohnet

customer_reviews.title: Like them
customer_reviews.text: Had these for about a month now. Took a while to get the fit right and really understand how to use them. I actually have different size tips on the ears and a wing on on one ear only. Had problems getting them to sit in the case properly with the wings and have them charge. Works fine now. Overall I really like them. Sound quality is very good and noise reduction is as good as my old Bose wired earbuds. Nice to have Alexa but I don’t use it that often.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Stop with the negativity. These are great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have read the negative reviews. I sure am glad i didn't listen. These buds are great. Once you purchase the memory foam earpieces they make them more comfortable and wearable. I work in a steel mill. Around cranes and semi. I put these in my ear and all the sound just fades away. Blocks all outside noise. And if i want i can let some sound in to be safe. The Alexa app is a bonus. I can tell her to play any music app and away she goes. So stop with the negative reviews. Buy the memory foam ear insert and enjoy some music or a movie people.
customer_reviews.author: ww

customer_reviews.title: Average at best
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound quality but nowhere near the class of the AirPods or many other products that I have or still do own. The positive to these is that they actually fit and hold well during workouts - which the AirPods do not - and the sound quality is above any of the $40-$60 no name brands you might buy here on amazon. The negatives are the software integration and pairing that will make you want to throw these against the nearest wall and crush them. Alexa pairing still does not work after 3 weeks and over 10 attempts. Given the price, you are better stretching a little more and getting the AirPods.
customer_reviews.author: bruce tucker

customer_reviews.title: My excitement turned to frustration, then to just plain aggravation!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, horrible & horrible! Not sure why Bose would allow their name to be associated with these earbuds. They have a very low quality, tinny sound with very little bass sound no matter how high you set the bass and/or how low you set the treble. The eartip fit test is a joke. I tried every combination of tips/bands and the results ALL came back either fair or test failed. DON'T BUY THESE! I recommend using the brand that matches your phone - i.e. Samsung with Samsung or Apple with Apple.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: A real junk product
customer_reviews.text: not sure if Amazon will publish this but this is a real disaster. Alexa works only if she feels for it. after some usage, it will recognize your ear if it wants to. most of time i have to give up using it. tapping functionality is a joke to activate. overall good concept but not for this product. it's a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonlover

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound and noise cancellation compared to Bose
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as they are supposedly designed by Bose. I have wired Bose earbuds and these are nowhere near as good. The sound quality is not in the same league. Neither is the noise cancellation. Perhaps I have a bad set? I would return them but I am traveling and will miss the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Walker

customer_reviews.title: 5 months after purchase and one bud is dead
customer_reviews.text: I'm a BIG Amazon product user. We have dozens of Alexa-enabled devices in our home. When I saw these buds and their promise of Bose noise cancellation at a reasonable price, I was impressed. I didn't much care for the fit, so instead of returning them, I gave them to my daughter. She takes scrupulous care of her things, and really enjoyed using them. UNTIL... the right earbud simply stopped charging. No connection, nothing. Completely dead. The left bud works fine; the case carries a charge, but the right bud? Nada. I saw the bad reviews before purchasing. Wish I had saved the money.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed and connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy on my ears. Gave me a headache. I had tons of issues with the bluetooth. Bluetooth went on and off at its own will and while I was on a call with handset. Car bluetooth interfered with echo. Computer connecting did not work well. Very let down by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product Design
customer_reviews.text: Several Problem with the product 1. Noise cancellation sub optimal. You hear a buzz sound which is not there 2. On treadmill, I hear loud boom sounds whenever I took a step in noise cancellation mode 3. Falls from my ears even after I tried everything Don't buy this. Wait for some more time for better product to be released
customer_reviews.author: pk

customer_reviews.title: Very unreliable and touchy and don’t work with my iPhone 7
customer_reviews.text: These are a pain in the rear. They don’t stay in well. I have to wear a headband so they don’t fall out when I run. Very difficult to adjust the Hook that goes on the ear. Mostly, they don’t connect well with my phone. I called tech support a few times. We reset and reset and they work for a bit then stop connecting to my phone. I literally bought a $25.00 pair that are more reliable. These are way better:  Don’t waste your money. It is so frustrating to be all ready to go for a run and not have your music work.
customer_reviews.author: NT in HB

customer_reviews.title: The best Bluetooth headphones ever! 💯
customer_reviews.text: I would just like to start by saying the first pair I received was a bad apple 🍎, of course Amazon replaced it with a new one. But these are great! They have customizable buttons, powerful sound with noise cancellation aswell as (Passthrough sound) which allows you to hear everything around you even with loud music. This is awesome because I work an a warehouse and I am constantly around forklifts, loud compactors and big rigs. Of course the best thing about these is the Alexa that allows me to start music and answer phone calls. Good job Amazon 👍
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Would repurchase at 50$ or less
customer_reviews.text: Everything feels cheap. Lots of audio bugs, like screeching when connecting to a laptop (occurred 2x on two different laptops) one time, I even had two different songs playing on each bud. Seems like a very alpha product. It stayed well in my ears but was painful in the left one after a few hours. Sound quality was pretty bad. Alexa was fun for 5 minutes. Initially I didn’t want to dish out 200$+ for the Apple competitors, but I don’t think I got my money’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: N. T

customer_reviews.title: Best earbuds I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal earbuds. The audio is amazing, the touch controls and changeable commands are the best I've ever had. The ability to control my lights at home or drop in on any of my dots with ease is very nice. Downsides are Alexa can sometimes mishear you. The ear buds are also very sensitive to magnetic fields. Weirdly sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these. All though I love all things Apple, the AirPods haven’t grown on me. When I saw these come out I thought I would give them a try. They were really hard to fit. The sound was different ever time I used them. Tiny sound and never got loud enough. I did like the Alexa integration but after the second day, Alexa basically ignored me. Between that, the fit and the sound, I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Cammarays

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after three months
customer_reviews.text: First, the ear buds don't respond well to voice commands. I guess the microphones are defective or something. But the worst part? After less than three months, the things dropped all connections and refused to pair with my smart phone, laptop, or anything else. I followed online instructions precisely, but no way would they pair with anything. I've tried numerous times. Factory reset, turn off & on again, wait for the flashing light, blah blah blah. Too expensive for all this hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Copenhaver

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy what until ?
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be better I never got my 3 months of audible save your money very upset .Think I might send it back
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Two Tin Cans and a String Would sound better
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these ear buds. I ordered them on the first day. I was so disappointed. They sounded so bad I figured I must have set them up wrong. If you have an iPhone, do NOT buy these under any circumstances. AirPods sound stellar by comparison and the price difference is much smaller since Pros came out. If you are on Android, I still think there must be better alternatives out there, but I'm not as familiar. I love my Fire Stick and Fire Recast, but this product should be taken off the market until Amazon can make it acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: SDG

product_meta.title: Echo Buds – Wireless earbuds with immersive sound, active noise reduction, and Alexa
feature_bullets: Immersive sound – Premium speaker drivers deliver crisp, dynamic audio. Bose Active Noise Reduction Technology and sealed in-ear design limits background noise.
Hands-free with Alexa – Echo Buds work with the Alexa app to stream music, play Audible audiobooks, make calls, or get directions—just ask.
Access other assistants – Supports access to Siri or Google Assistant from a supported device—just press and hold your earbud.
Long-lasting battery – Get up to 5 hrs music playback per charge, up to 2 hrs with a 15-min quick charge, and up to 20 hrs with the charging case.
Customizable fit for better sound – 3 sizes of ear tips help form a comfortable in-ear seal for immersive listening.
Exercise ready – Sweat-resistant with a secure fit that’s made to move with you.
Alexa is always getting smarter and adding new skills – Request a rideshare, get a guided workout, or order dinner, all hands-free.
Designed to protect your privacy - Built with multiple layers of privacy protections and controls, including the ability to mute the mics with the Alexa app.
